author: travelandtourworld.com
title: easyJet puts more than 1 million seats on sale from Bristol Airport for summer 2016Travelandtourworld.com
text:
easyJet puts more than 1 million seats on sale from Bristol Airport for summer 2016  
easyJet, Bristol’s largest and Europe’s leading airline, has today put more than 1,000,728 seats from Bristol Airport on sale for summer 2016 on over 6,018 flights between 27 June and 4 September.
 
Over 17,200,000 summer seats are being launched today across the entire easyJet network, making the summer flight release easyJet’s biggest in its history for that period.
 
Ali Gayward, easyJet’s UK Commercial Manager, said:
 
“Now the cold nights are starting to draw in, to many it feels like this summer is a distant memory so we’re really pleased to be putting our schedule for next year on sale now to give customers booking early for summer 2016 something to look forward to.
 
“As well as our low fares and friendly customer service, our passengers in the South West can take advantage of flights to 56 great destinations across Europe, including nine brand new ones launched earlier this year such as Venice, Catania and Porto. Whether they are looking for a beach break, active adventure or city escape, easyJet has something for everyone.”
 
Customers can take advantage of low fares to destinations including:
 
Bristol to Krakow from £26.24*
Bristol to Paris Charles de Gaulle from £22.24*
Bristol to Faro from £20.24*
Bristol to Edinburgh from £18.24*
Bristol to Split from £21.49*
Bristol to Paphos from £32.49*
 
*Fares per person, one way, based on two people travelling on the same booking.
 
easyJet has bases across 11 UK airports and flies more than 750 routes on its network across Europe, the Middle East and North Africa.
 
The airline is making travel easier for its passengers thanks to its award-winning mobile app where passengers can search and book for flights, get live flight updates and download their boarding passes straight to their mobile phone.
